EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.98}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Risk on the y-axis?

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Accounting and Growth or the cell corresponding to Financial Tech and Growth?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Financial Tech} and {Growth} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Financial Tech and Liabilities or the cell corresponding to Financial Tech and Revenue?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Financial Tech} and {Revenue} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Financial Tech and Market Share or the cell corresponding to Accounting and Revenue?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Accounting} and {Revenue} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.88 to 0.97?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Risk Management, Assets), (Accounting, Equity), (Insurance, Growth), (Risk Management, Market Share), (Accounting, Revenue), (Banking, Revenue), (Risk Management, Revenue)}.
